title: Recover debt from elsewhere in the EU

details.description: Debt recovery if you're owed money from people or businesses in another EU country - how to ask for a repayment
details.body:
If you’re owed money by someone in another EU country, you can recover the debt using internationally-recognised court forms.

This is known as making a ‘cross-border’ claim. You will have to pay a court fee.

If they admit owing the money

If the other person or business admits owing the money, you can make a European Payment Order.

If they deny owing the money

If they deny owing the money, and you’re owed less than €2,000, you can use the European Small Claims procedure.

For larger sums of money, you may have to use the national court system, and should get legal advice:

  • find a legal adviser (England and Wales)
  • find a solicitor (Scotland)

Find out more about making a cross-border claim in the EU.
